    • Method Detail

      • haveBigScreen

        public static boolean haveBigScreen(Activity activity)

        Checks if the device has a big screen using the currently shown Activity for accessing window manager in order to retrieve the device's DisplayMetrics.

        The decision whether is screen size is "big" or not depends on a couple of things. First of all, it is checked whether Configuration.screenLayout is set to eiter large or extra-large. Depending on this check, on of the following two things are checked:

        1. If large or xlarge: it's a matter of DPI whether it really is a big screen or not.
        2. If not large and not xlarge: check whether the screen-size in pixels is greater than 480x800 and 800x480.

        If this evaluates to true, the screen is a big one.

        Parameters:
        activity - The currently shown activity.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the device has a big screen, false otherwise.
        Since:
        Class 1.0, API 1.0.0

      • getDisplayMetrics

        public static DisplayMetrics getDisplayMetrics(Activity activity)
        Returns the display metrics of the device, using the currently shown Activity for accessing the window manager.
        Parameters:
        activity - The currently shown Activity.
        Returns:
        the DisplayMetrics of the device.
        Since:
        Class 1.0, API 1.0.0

      • getScreenOrientation

        public static int getScreenOrientation(Activity activity)
        Returns the current orientation of the device.
        Parameters:
        activity - The currently shown activity
        Returns:
        ORIENTATION_PORTRAIT if it's portrait-oriented, Configuration.ORIENTATION_LANDSCAPE if it's landscape or Configuration.ORIENTATION_SQUARE if the orientation has equal width and height, and the device has a recent enough operating-system.
        Since:
        Class 1.0, API 1.0.0

      • orientationIsLandscape

        public static boolean orientationIsLandscape(Activity activity)
        Convenience method to quickly identify landscape-orientation
        Parameters:
        activity - The currently shown activity
        Returns:
        true if orientation is landscape, false otherwise
        Since:
        Class 1.0, API 1.0.0
